DOC.brief_summary: This study will examine if MRI perfusion and PET/CT can tell growing tumor and radiation injury apart. MRI perfusion looks at the blood vessels in the tumor. PET/CT looks if the tumor cells are actively growing. The investigators will do these two tests and see which one is better. Optional Second MRI Perfusion The investigators may ask the patient to undergo a second MRI perfusion scan. They are testing this second scan to see how well it works. It can cover the entire brain. It takes about an 5 extra minutes in the scanner. If they decide to undergo this second scan, they will divide the usual IV contrast dose into two parts. The patient will not receive extra IV contrast for this second scan. This second scan is optional.
DOC.brief_title: A Comparison of MRI Perfusion and FDG PET/CT to Distinguish Between Radiation Injury and Tumor Progression
